alert.note: Alert for Tooele (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 21 at 5:36PM MDT until September 21 at 7:15PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING FOR THE JACOB CITY BURN SCAR REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR EASTERN TOOELE COUNTY... At 536 PM MDT, local law enforcement reported a flash flood wave reaching SR 36 just south of Stockton, and mud flows breaching the main channel of Soldier Creek within Soldier Canyon. 1 house has been evacuated, and the northbound lane on SR 36 has been closed in the area. Between 0.25 and 0.75 inches of rain have fallen over the burn scar from earlier thunderstorms. Flash flooding is already occurring. Excessive rainfall over the burn scar will result in debris flow moving through the Soldier Creek. The debris flow can consist of rock, mud, vegetation and other loose materials. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding in and around the Jacob City Burn Scar. SOURCE...Law enforcement reported. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of areas in and around the Jacob City Burn Scar. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Soldier Canyon and SR 36 just south of the town of Stockton. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Move away from recently burned areas. Life-threatening flooding of creeks, roads and normally dry washes is likely. The heavy rains will likely trigger rockslides, mudslides and debris flows in steep terrain, especially in and around these areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
